meanings.definition: To restore a silver coating to (an object).
meanings.sent1: The skilled craftsman resilvered the antique mirror to make it shine again.
meanings.sent2: The old tray was resilvered to bring back its original luster.
meanings.sent3: After the magician's failed trick, he tried to resilvered the tarnished coin to impress the audience.
meanings.sent4: She hoped to resilvered her tarnished reputation by volunteering at the local shelter.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays seemed to resilvered the surface of the calm lake, creating a dazzling reflection.

meanings.definition: Having been given a new silver coating.
meanings.sent1: The resilvered teapot gleamed on the shelf, catching the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The resilvered frame added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent3: The resilvered jewelry sparkled like stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent4: Her resilvered phone case looked brand new, hiding its age.
meanings.sent5: The resilvered antique watch was a prized possession, passed down through generations.
